message_1: If sin x = 0.5, find the value of x in radians using the inverse trigonometric function.
message_2:
To find the value of x in radians using the inverse trigonometric function, we use the arcsin (sin^(-1)) function:

x = arcsin(0.5)

x ≈ π/6 or 5π/6

There are two values for x in the interval [0, 2π] because the sine function is positive in both the first and second quadrants. So, x can be π/6 (30°) or 5π/6 (150°).
